poem:
Border Morning

The paper  
smells of gun oil  
and coffee.

Colombia  
moves men  
to the line—  
not a line  
but a river  
of feet.

Caracas before dawn:  
a jar dropped  
in the dark.

"Captured," says Trump.  
Where is the body  
of the word?

Petro calls the UN.  
Mothers fold  
their names into cloth  
and walk.
